name: Mercure Hotel Severinshof Koeln City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel via travelsupermarket and cost us just under £70 for a 3 night stay (3rd night is free). It's a 4* hotel and is situated right next to the Severinshof metro line, we didn't hear any noise whilst the windows were closed although did hear someone complaining in reception about the noise of the trams.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and rooms were great for the price, the bathroom was really nice and the shower gels/bubble baths replenished daily. The only reason I can think the price was so low was the demolition site outside the front entrance. When we arrived we were rather concerned but once inside the hotel all was great. The reception staff were all lovely and extremely helpful, although some of the bar staff were a bit off, moaning as we asked for some ice!! It was a boiling hot day and we didn't think it would be a problem but apparently it was!!!
I can't comment on the food of this hotel as we like to eat out.

reviews.text: We only stayed for a night and would have happily stayed for a few extra.
reviews.title: good choice to visit koln RECOMENDED

reviews.text: We came to stay at this hotel for 2 days over a weekend for the Cologne Christmas Markets. 25th-27th Nov. This is the start of the Xmas markets and a good time to go as it gets busier in Dec so its slightly less crowded. Please note a lot of the shops and markets don't open on Sundays so save Sunday for sight seeing and do your shopping on Saturday if you go for a weekend..The Markets open until 10.00pm at night. There is such a lot of nice cheap food to chose from at these markets too we were spoilt for choice on what to eat. I recommend the market on the floating ship on the Rhein opposite the Dom Catherdral its lovely and well lit up at night.. This hotel is very nice and clean and the staff are all very helpful and speak very good English. Ask for a room which overlooks the court yard as its lovely and quiet. There are some rooms on the front where the traffic and trains go by, they could be noisy, also there is currently a lot of road works going on outside the hotel so again, I think a room at the back would be the better choice. It takes a good 15 minute walk into the centre but it is all main road and we felt quite safe walking around, in fact Cologne feels safe to walk around in anyway. From the hotel there is a regular bus service to the train station every 10 minutes. 132 and 133 service. The train station is at the Catherdral and central. We got a 48 hour pass from the information centre at the airport when we arrived. (Bonn/Koeln). 9 Euros for 24 hours or 14 Euros for 48 hours. This lets you use all trains/buses/trams for that period and well worth it. We took a train to Bonn for the afternoon with this ticket it takes 30 minutes to get to Bonn. There is a 20 minute train service from Platfrom 2 at the airport into the centre of Cologne (15 min journey) (30 minute service at weekends). It is excellent. It costs 2.20 Euros for a single journey or you can use your travel card purchased from the airport. The hotel rooms are huge and clean, nice bathroom toiletries too. Little mini bar with soft drinks and beers (no spirits) We paid 70 euros per room per night through Expedia which was good value. The breakfast is very nice buffett and lots of choice but very pricey 15 euros. There is a Subway food shop right next to the hotel which is open long hours. We got a breakfast bagette (ham/cheese toasted) and a coffee for 3.30 euros. The cheaper option for breakfast and it was very nice. We took it back to the room. There is a nice bar but again quite expensive. All in all this is a great little hotel for the price, but it is a 15 minute walk into the centre. You can take the sceanic route walk along the rhein to town which is quite nice. Some lovely quaint little bars and kellars on the way into town.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star.
Friendly and comfortable
reviews.text: my girlfriend and i staid there four 4 nights and everything was Ok, except an extrange smell that appears sometimes.

Just stayed 1 night at the Mercure in a twin room. For the money we paid (£60) it was great, clean, comfortable beds, good bathroom, nice and quiet even though train stop out the front. Location is good, you can walk to the main centre in 15 mins, taxi from airport €23. Reception was friendly and english speaking as most placed in Germany are. Didnt have breakfast is it was €15 but aparently its quite good. Would definitely stay again if i went back to Cologne, but I think 1 day was enough, theres not a hell of a lot to do apart from climb the Catherdral.

description: The Mercure Severinsh Koeln City 4* has 253 rooms and suites. It is located in the city centre, only a few minutes walk from Cologne Cathedral, the old town centre and the Rhine river. All rooms are comfortable, cosy and airconditioned. Some feature balconies. The hotel offers a restaurant, a bar, 6 multifunctional meeting rooms, gym, sauna and solarium. The Mercure Hotel Severinshof Koln is the ideal host for your stay in our city.
